Centaurea integrifolia Meyer (1831: 64)
, nom. illeg. , non
C. integrifolia Tausch (1828: 485)
.
Amblyopogon integrifolius (Koch) Boissier (1856: 66)
.
Centaurea meyeriana Tzvelev (1959: 418)
.
Amblyopogon meyerianus (Tzvelev) Karjagin (1961: 454)
, nom. inval. (Art. 41.5 of the ICN,
Turland et al. 2018
).
Amblyopogon meyerianus (Tzvelev) Soják (1962: 47)
. Type:— AZERBAIJAN . In locis siccis lapidosis montium Talüsh prope pagum Swant [Zuvand], June 1830 , Meyer 523 ( lectotype LE01071993! designated here by Negaresh, isolectotypes LE01071994!, LE01071995!, W!).

subSubSection.paragraph: Perennial herbs, with long rhizome, whole plant usually grayish, remains of leaf bases of the previous year present. Stems solitary or few, arising from the base of the rosette, prostrate or ascending, 8–10 cm tall, densely leafy throughout, ca. 3 mm in diam. at the base, cylindrical, with thin white striations, densely covered with appressed-cinereoustomentose hairs. Leaves coriaceous, densely covered with appressed-grayish-tomentose hairs and punctate-glands, undivided, lanceolate, 3–6 × 0.5–1 cm , denticulate at margins, acuminate at apex; rosette leaves petiolate; cauline leaves narrowed toward base. Capitula few, 1–2(–3)-cephalous, solitary on sessile peduncles; involucres ovoid, 17–20 × 13–18 mm . Phyllaries multiseriate, outer and median ones ovate, innermost lanceolate-linear, coriaceous, imbricate, greenish, glabrous. Appendages medium-sized, membranous, concealing a major part of phyllaries, straw-coloured in margins, brown in central part, triangular to lanceolate, 4–5 × 1.8–2.5 mm (excluding cilia), regularly ciliate, never with a spine; cilia straw-coloured, numerous, 12–15(–20) on each side, 1.3–1.8 mm long. Flowers pink; central florets hermaphroditic, numerous, 16–18 mm long, corolla 6–8 mm long, 5-lobed, lobes 3–4 mm long, stigma exserted from corolla up to 2 mm ; peripheral florets slightly longer than central ones, not radiant, with staminodes, 4-lobed, limb lobes narrowly lanceolate. Achenes oblong, ca. 4 mm long, smooth, ± pubescent. Pappus persistent, scabrous, double, 1 / 3 – 1 / 2 as long as achenes, 1–1.5 mm long, bristles of inner pappus much wider than those of outer.

Distribution: —
Psephellus integrifolius
is endemic to the Caucasus and occurs in Azerbaijan ( Fig. 7 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 7. Distribution of
Psephellus integrifolius
(circles) and
P. karduchorum
(squares).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ecology: —
Psephellus integrifolius
grows on clayey and stony slopes, in the middle-montane zone, at elevations of 1800–2000 m ( Tzvelev 1963 ).

Taxonomic notes: —
Psephellus integrifolius
is a Mediterranean element and is the only species of the Asiatic P. sect.
Amblyopogon
that is found in the Mediterranean region ( Fig. 7 ). It closely resembles
P. incanescens
in its habit.
